ug_programs.note: Top grade (A+) covers 20 marks range (80-100); all other passing grades cover 10 marks range.

pg_programs.note: Top grade (A+) covers 20 marks range (80-100); all other passing grades cover 10 marks range.

ug_200_marks.note: Top grade (A+) covers 40 marks range (160-200); all other passing grades cover 20 marks range. This is a scaled version of the 100-marks scheme.

pg_200_marks.note: Top grade (A+) covers 40 marks range (160-200); all other passing grades cover 20 marks range.

special_grade_indicators.AB: Absence in examination, considered as backlog
special_grade_indicators.F: Fail in Examination, considered as backlog. Marks forwarded from the last examinations.
special_grade_indicators.*: Indicates carry forwarded marks from the last examinations
special_grade_indicators.+: Indicates subject passed with grace marks

terminology.CIE: Continuous Internal Evaluation or Internal Assessment
terminology.GPA: Semester Grade Point Average = Σ(Credits × Grade) / Σ Credits

gpa_formula.formula: GPA = Σ(Credits × Grade Points) / Σ Credits
gpa_formula.cgpa_basis: CGPA is calculated based on the last four semesters' performance

chatbot_training_qa.question: What grade do I get if I score 85 out of 100 in a UG exam?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: You get grade A+ with 10 grade points, as your marks (85) fall in the 80-100 range.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What grade do I get if I score 72 out of 100?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: You get grade A with 9 grade points, as your marks (72) fall in the 70-79 range.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What grade do I get if I score 38 out of 100?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: You get grade F with 0 grade points, as your marks (38) are below 40. This is considered a fail/backlog.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What grade do I get if I score 170 out of 200?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: You get grade A+ with 10 grade points, as your marks (170) fall in the 160-200 range for a 200-mark exam.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What grade do I get if I score 130 out of 200?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: You get grade B+ with 8 grade points, as your marks (130) fall in the 120-139 range for a 200-mark exam.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What does AB grade mean?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: AB stands for Absent. It indicates absence in the examination and is considered as a backlog.

chatbot_training_qa.question: How is GPA calculated?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: GPA (Grade Point Average) = Σ(Credits × Grade Points) / Σ Credits. It represents your Semester Grade Point Average.

chatbot_training_qa.question: How do I convert CGPA to percentage at Indus University?
What CGPA do I need for First Class with Distinction?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: You need FGPA ≥ 7.50 to be awarded First Class with Distinction.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What is the minimum marks to pass a 100-mark UG exam?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: You need at least 40 marks out of 100 to pass. Scoring below 40 results in an F grade (fail).

chatbot_training_qa.question: What is the minimum marks to pass a 200-mark UG exam?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: You need at least 80 marks out of 200 to pass. Scoring below 80 results in an F grade (fail).

chatbot_training_qa.question: What does the * symbol on my marksheet mean?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: The * symbol indicates that the marks were carry forwarded from the last examination.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What does the + symbol on my marksheet mean?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: The + symbol indicates that the subject was passed with grace marks.
